The Boston Globe endorsed a statewide moratorium on face surveillance technology.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Read The Endorsement

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The ACLU of Massachusetts is leading a campaign against dystopian face surveillance technology in the Commonwealth, and we wanted to make sure you heard about the latest, exciting development.

This month, The Boston Globe endorsed a statewide moratorium on government use of face surveillance in Massachusetts. The ACLU-backed bill would ensure that we establish crucial safeguards against this dangerous, unregulated technology.

The Globe shares the ACLU's concerns about the unprecedented dangers of pervasive face surveillance, and we welcome their endorsement. It's just another sign of the growing movement against unregulated biometric surveillance that threatens our civil liberties.

An ACLU-conducted poll revealed that 79 percent of Massachusetts voters support a statewide moratorium, and several cities and towns across the Commonwealth – including Cambridge, Somerville, and Brookline – are taking action to protect the privacy of their residents by banning face surveillance.

We hope you'll read this endorsement and share it with your friends, family, and colleagues. Together, we can maintain a strong movement for privacy and liberty.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Massachusetts
